embeds.title: Shadow Cloak
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Whenever you draw or **Exhaust** a **Curse**, gain 4 (6) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: ah yes
block power
if you can get it to come online, it's really strong
Waiter! Waiter! More block engine please!
I don't get how you make this work
you have to draw this
then generate the curses
then draw the curses
and with manifest not drawing curses anymore, idgi

THE Hermit late game block engine card
It fundamentally changes how cards on Hermit are picked because It exists in the card pool
1 (ideally 2 or more) copies of this in the right deck changes everything
<luck of the draw> helps the drawing aspect a ton

embeds.title: Luck of the Draw
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Draw until you draw 3 (4) total :energy_hermit:  worth of cards.

messages.content: Since curses cost 0 (most of the time)
If hermit had a fire breathing but for curses they would be really strong
Luck of the draw, Roulette, Dead mans hand and fatal Desire are all specially nice with a lot curses
<dead mans hand>

embeds.title: Dead Man's Hand
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 (0) :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Discard your hand. Add the 3 rarest cards from your draw pile to your hand.

messages.content: This literally cannot draw curses
It's free draw but it can't hit any of the shadow cloak procs
It discards your hand full of curses and draws 3 playable cards
Oh well yeah that's good
But it's really dependent on how you built your deck
Fatal desire is fatal desire aka real good
And roulette in addition to fatal desire is extremely great
A problem in curse decks is that sometimes you draw too many curses, any form of draw is welcome, the drawback of Dead mans hand becomes a lot less noticeable and the upside is a lot bigger
Oh wait dead mans hand can draw curses
If that's all that's in your draw pile
Shadow cloak strats pray for <scatterbrained>

embeds.title: Scatterbrained
embeds.description:
Curse / Downfall

**Unplayable**.
When drawn, if it is your turn, fill your hand with ****Echo**es** of this card.

messages.content: Hermit is a hero, he doesnt get scatterbrained
Damn

This helps to mitigate how bad curses are, but it doesn’t make having them in your deck actually good. It does work well with the starting ascenders bane, and counts memento after your first reshuffle. Critically, there aren’t very many cards that exhaust curses (covet, malice, adapt, final canter, the clumsy from misfire) and several of those are rares. You will also need to draw them alongside the curses in order to proc shadow cloak, which can be finnicky. The other half of shadow cloak also doesn’t work nicely with a few key cards. You have to specifically draw the curse, so adding it to your hand (manifest, midnight, fatal desire) doesn’t count. If you can wait to reshuffle your draw pile, they will start working together better, but this can often take too long to be practical. 
The other really important thing to remember here is that every curse or curse generator you add to your deck to support shadow cloak makes it harder to find it and get it into play (you could choose not to play your spray n’ pray or misfire until after drawing shadow cloak, but then you are effectively playing with dead cards already). If I could guarantee finding a bottled tornado to put this in, or if the upgrade made it innate, I would find it much more useful. As it is, the very act of trying to support it adds significant inconsistency to your block engine. The only really consistent way to try and alleviate this issue is by drafting tons of card draw (especially luck of the draw, since most curses have no energy cost) and just trying to dig through your deck as fast as possible to get shadow cloak in play and get a reshuffle for your fatal desire/memento/other generated curses.
Hermit also has a Lot of good front-loaded block options so have some time to get the engine going

Leaning into curses as much as shadow cloak wants you to will also make it much harder to proc dead-on effects, as you can’t play the curses to move your hand around. This can be pretty solid with clasped locket, but that is one very specific boss relic. This is like a feel no pain that is much harder to support (A third of the ironclad pool has exhaust, and many of those can be used to gain block on the turn you play feel no pain), and wants you to put curses in your deck to enable it. Feel no pain also notably works with dazes and slimes, but you are going to have to provide your own curses, and they can prevent you from drawing shadow cloak in the first place. Shadow cloak absolutely can work as a scaling block solution, but the stars really need to align for you, or you will need to find multiple copies so that you can draw it early on in fights more reliably.

I will note that I have recently come up on this card a bit for one major reason, and that is scarcity. Hermit simply has very few scaling mitigation tools, pretty much just maintenance and shadow cloak, really. However, nearly every run you are going to reach a point where you will need scaling mitigation in order to handle the heavy damage of certain enemies (mostly bosses, giant head, nemesis, some act 3 hallway fights). No matter how awkward I find supporting shadow cloak to be, I can’t deny that it is one of the only tools you have, and that makes it necessary to be willing to include it and support it, or else risk dying to the act 2 boss, or in act 3 or 4 because you can’t scale your defense. Card draw is perhaps the most important element I have been adding to my decks to support shadow cloak, since you really need to reshuffle your deck quickly in order to enable many other cards synergies with it (with fatal desire being the most critical).
Holy wall of text
I read it all tho
Man if shadow cloaks upgrade was innate it'd be THE scaling solution for late game
I mean you do have maintenance but maintenance is pretty slow
Unless you get multiple copies
It's funny that sometimes giving a power innate isn't actually trolling
It would maybe be too strong with putting curses in your deck

It's usually decent in act 1, if you can draw it before ascenders' bane, you get 8 block, and if you can wait to reshuffle memento that can be another 4. Your deck is also smaller in act 1, meaning that you can draw cloak earlier, and reshuffle memento and other curses back in faster to benefit from the block. If you have found any of the curse generators early on, it will usually do fairly well, and since it is one of your only options for scaling defense, I don't mind taking it early and hoping to find support for it. Usually won't do much into any of the act 1 elites, but can be fine into the bosses. Becomes a much more appealing pick as you head into acts 3 and 4, just due to sheer necessity of having scaling block, and because of that, I am willing to lean into taking cards like spray n' pray and misfire much higher than normal at the start of the run. The current upgrade is still quite strong, and definitely worth prioritizing, especially if you have several ways to exhaust curses and make it a +4 more frequently. The most important thing is to find card draw to get that first reshuffle done as quickly as possible, relics like snecko eye and ink bottle can help wit that as well. You may also want to invest in more strong front-loaded block like hole up or midnight (also has curse synergies) so that you don't die/lose too much health to chip damage while waiting for that first reshuffle to happen.
It doesn't draw, it adds them to your hand.
so <misfire> is kind of a wild strike-esque meme card, but if you have an upgraded copy or two of shadow cloak i think it’s a genuinely powerful pick

embeds.title: Misfire
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 11 (15) damage.
Shuffle a Clumsy into your draw pile.

messages.content: it basically becomes “deal 11 damage, shuffle a 0-cost block 12 card into your deck”

hermit’s draw is kind of few and far between, but what he DOES have, like roulette, luck of the draw, ennervate etc, is really quite powerful and makes me feel better about building around shadow cloak
cant forget overwhelming power or fatal desire, both of which can be quite good paired with this
generally the easiest way to build a block engine on hermit is gonna be dive spamming but this is also quite a solid option that allows you to build in directions you might not take normally
i’m fond of this card, there are so many modded attempts of “erm, what if curses…were good???” and hermit does the best job by far with that concept
I kinda disagree, I don't really think hermit makes me want to build curses tbh
but that’s just it
it’s like how you’re not going to get anywhere by building only statuses on ironclad
curse synergy is a thing with hermit but it’s not his entire gameplan
and i like how the game kind of gently introduces you to the idea that hermit might be able to do more with curses by way of his starting relic

Curses and statuses are virtually the same, and I think auto has a better status design (except bug barrage, that's the only one I'd consider too strong and ship it being god awful) than hermit does curse.
i guess with auto i'm like a kid getting distracted by jingly keys, trying to build the perfect iron wave +++, that i don't tend to think about his status synergies as much
which says more about me as a player than any actual design stuff lol
Yeah functions are just very strong and easy to build into
I love how Shadow Cloak kinda warps how I build a Hermit deck even before I get It, I take stuff like Roulette, LotD and DMH pretty highly because of the existence of this card
It also tends me towards lower cost cards as Hermit, as those also go well with those cards
roulette is a good pick in the first place imo
three strikes glued together and taped to one of the best cards in the game (calc gamble) is muy bueno
There is a nice minigame when I play Hermit, where the main question is "How hard should I be building my deck around possibly getting Shadow Cloak?"
Its a really good out for blocking late game, though It needs to be in the right deck
Shadow Cloak decks are best when slim and cycle fast, which is usually not true for other kinds of Hermit decks
I take all of these cards and I rarely take shadow cloak.
The payoff for cycling your deck multiple times is mainly in Shadow Cloak and From Beyond
Well, they are also good outside of curse decks, curse decks is Just another reason to take them
Dead man's hand is not that good. Dead man's hand+ is pretty good.
DMH+ is pretty insane
0 cost "draw 3"
I value DMH really highly and upgrade It right away
Slim decks also make really good use of Covet, both as draw and a way to Exhaust curses when you need the extra block in a pinch
Though exhausting curses is usually not that good of an idea as you want to reach a critical mass of curses to block for you
Slimmer decks can also get away with having less curse generators, I have won Shadow Cloak runs with only 1 Midnight in my deck, 1-3 is usually the right amount
The best one to pair with SD is Midnight, since It buys you time with Its front loaded block to help you reach a high amount of curses
Unless you Fatal Desire, Fatal Desire is all you need for curse gen If you have It
I dont value misfire highly at all since clumsy exhausts, you would need to have more generators in your deck to compensate
Which hurts the game plan of having a slim deck that cycles a lot
Ironclad has massive tools for that kit though <evolve>for drawing actual cards<fire breathing>for DPS and <second wind> to prevent deck clog

embeds.title: Evolve
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Whenever you draw a **Status** card, draw 1 (2) card (cards).

embeds.title: Fire Breathing
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Whenever you draw a **Status** or **Curse** card, deal 6 (10) damage to ALL enemies.

embeds.title: Second Wind
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

**Exhaust** all non-Attack cards in your hand. Gain 5 (7) **Block** :p_block: for each card **Exhaust**ed.
